intro: Desmocladus brunonianus, commonly known as the blackwood tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other economically important hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its dark, dense wood and compound leaves with opposite arrangement. It produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. Due to its valuable timber, it is often harvested for commercial use, though it faces threats from overexploitation and habitat loss.
